name: GET-video-status
description: This API provides upload status & encoding status to determine when the video is uploaded or ready to playback. Once encoding is completed, the response also lists the available stream qualities. Tutorials using [video status](https://api.video/blog/endpoints/video-status).

videoId.description: The unique identifier for the video you want the status for.

$ul: **encoding**
**metadata**
**aspectRatio**
**audioCodec**: The method used to compress and decompress digital audio for your video.
**bitrate**: The number of bits processed per second.
**duration**: The length of the video.
**framerate**: The frequency with which consecutive images or frames appear on a display. Shown in this API as frames per second (fps).
**height**: The height of the video in pixels.

**samplerate**: How many samples per second a digital audio system uses to record an audio signal. The higher the rate, the higher the frequencies that can be recorded. They are presented in this API using hertz.
**videoCodec**: The method used to compress and decompress digital video. API Video supports all codecs in the libavcodec library.
**width**: The width of the video in pixels.
**playable**: Whether the video is playable or not.
**qualities**: Available qualities the video can be viewed in.
**ingest**: Details about the capturing, transferring, and storing of your video for use immediately or in the future.
**filesize**: The size of your file in bytes.
**receivedBytes**: The total number of bytes received, listed for each chunk of the upload.

**status**: There are three possible ingest statuses. missing - you are missing information required to ingest the video. uploading - the video is in the process of being uploaded. uploaded - the video is ready for use.
